Reviews.Title: Windows 8
Reviews.Author: OGChristoph
Reviews.Content: Is not too bad.  The space has to really be pushed but other than that I am happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Second Asus Laptop! Love it!
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: My first laptop with an Intel i3 and wow this computer is fast! Coming from a guy who constantly bought HP after getting my first Asus I'm never going back. The quality build of this laptop and the way it performs is fantastic. I highly recommend this laptop to anyone searching for a great laptop at an incredible value. I paid $499 so anything under that is a steal! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy one of these
Reviews.Author: Asghar Gholizadeh
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake buying this laptop. I had problems both in software and hardware. Bad keyboard. annoying system speed.Don't buy one of these

Reviews.Title: This might just be me
Reviews.Author: Tao c.
Reviews.Content: After having attempted the several ways to potentially indentify the problem, it finally comes down to either the laptop has a symptom similar to the commonly refered "graining screen" by wide experiencers. Though if this system uses deficient screen is my misunderstanding, and the display is normal for the specs it has, I'm sorry I am mispersuading for the quality the manufacturer ought to present. Then the incentive for me to return this laptop would be the lack of display quality of this specific model.All in one, the spec of this laptop for its price is easily a shimmer in the pool of laptops at the 400$ range, known for their unreliability and the usually expected blockage to better performance due to little investment. The top reason being it is Asus, differentiating itself from the other for its sturdy quality.

Reviews.Title: Bought from BestBuy
Reviews.Author: Android 006
Reviews.Content: I don't like it. From the first week I had it I had a serious problem with it. I was so close to returning to the store for a complete refund but I myself (with some chat support) fixed the issue. I didn't return it because it was a huge hassle (I live in Mexico). I kept it and regret it - I would constantly get the blue screen of death when disconnecting my cell phone from the computer after transferring music. It recently updated to Windows 8.1 and seems that's resolved but still.
